member.name: T:BaseballScraper.Controllers.CbsControllers.CbsTransactionTrendsController
member.summary: Retrieve Cbs player trends: Most added, most dropped, most viewed, most traded
member.list:
INDEX
Get Most Added / Dropped All
Get Most Added / Dropped By Position
Print Most Added / Dropped
Get Most Viewed All
Get Most Viewed
Get Most Traded All
Get Most Traded By Position

RESOURCES
Most Added: https://www.cbssports.com/fantasy/baseball/trends/added/all
Most Dropped: https://www.cbssports.com/fantasy/baseball/trends/dropped/all
Most Viewed: https://www.cbssports.com/fantasy/baseball/trends/viewed/all
Most Traded https://www.cbssports.com/fantasy/baseball/trends/traded/all

member.name: M:BaseballScraper.Controllers.CbsControllers.CbsTransactionTrendsController.GetListOfCbsMostAddedOrDropped(System.String)
member.summary: Returns a list of the most added or dropped players according to Cbs trends; Does not filter by position
member.remarks: CbsRankCurrentWeek - % of leagues that have the player on a roster this week CbsRankPreviousWeek - % of leagues that have the player on a roster last week
member.param: The url of the Cbs roster trends; Should be either the url for most added or most dropped
member.returns: A list of most added or dropped players

member.name: M:BaseballScraper.Controllers.CbsControllers.CbsTransactionTrendsController.GetListOfCbsMostAddedOrDroppedByPosition(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Returns a list of the most added or dropped players according to Cbs trends filtered by position
member.remarks: CbsRankCurrentWeek - % of leagues that have the player on a roster this week CbsRankPreviousWeek - % of leagues that have the player on a roster last week
member.param: The url of the Cbs roster trends; Should be either the url for most added or most dropped
Position type: 1B, 2B, 3B, SS, OF, C, DH, SP, RP
member.returns: A list of most added or dropped players for one position

member.param: A list of added or dropped players

member.name: T:BaseballScraper.Controllers.FanGraphs.FgSpMasterReportController
member.list:
INDEX
View Page
Set Initial Url to Scrape
Get Number of Pages to Scrape
Get Urls of Pages to Scrape
Get Urls of Pages to Scrape
Scrape Pitchers and Create List
Count the Nodes Children
Get Table Header Values

RESOURCES
FanGraphs custom report this scraper targets: https://bit.ly/2N2somI

member.name: M:BaseballScraper.Controllers.FanGraphs.FgSpMasterReportController.SetInitialUrlToScrape(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: This defines the first url to scrape; At times, you may need to loop through multiple urls and the url defined here is the first url in the loop
member.param: The minimum number of innings pitched a pitcher needs to be included in the results of the scrape
The Mlb season year
The page to being scraping; this typically will be one. But if you want to start on page 2 (for example), just set 'page' to 2
The number of rows in the table; Standard options include 30, 50 , 100; This will ultimately influence the total number of urls and their tables to scrape
member.returns: A string url

member.name: M:BaseballScraper.Controllers.FanGraphs.FgSpMasterReportController.GetNumberOfPagesToScrape(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: This counts the number of urls that will be scraped; It examines a specific html element on the fangraphs html page that shows the number of pages
member.example: '70 items in 3 page' --> the '3' is what this method is looking for
member.param: The minimum number of innings pitched a pitcher needs to be included in the results of the scrape
The Mlb season year
The page to being scraping; this typically will be one. But if you want to start on page 2 (for example), just set 'page' to 2
The number of rows in the table; Standard options include 30, 50 , 100; This will ultimately influence the total number of urls and their tables to scrape
member.returns: A number of the number of pages to scrape as part of the loop

member.name: M:BaseballScraper.Controllers.FanGraphs.FgSpMasterReportController.GetUrlsOfPagesToScrape
member.returns: A list of strings representing urls to be scraped

member.name: M:BaseballScraper.Controllers.FanGraphs.FgSpMasterReportController.GetUrlsOfPagesToScrape(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: OPTION 2: parameters are passed into the method (i.e minInningsPitched, year, page, recordsPerPage ). Retrieves all urls of pages that will be scraped and adds them to a list
member.example: '70 items in 3 page' --> the '3' is what this method is looking for
member.param: The minimum number of innings pitched a pitcher needs to be included in the results of the scrape
The Mlb season year
The page to being scraping; this typically will be one. But if you want to start on page 2 (for example), just set 'page' to 2
The number of rows in the table; Standard options include 30, 50 , 100; This will ultimately influence the total number of urls and their tables to scrape
member.returns: A list of strings representing urls to be scraped

member.name: T:BaseballScraper.Controllers.MlbDataApiControllers.MlbDataHittingLeadersController
member.summary: Provides two options on how to generate leading hitter model OPTION 1 - endpoint parameters passed as parameters to method OPTION 2 - endpoint parameters defined within the method
member.list:
INDEX
Create Hitting Leaders Model (Option 1)
Create Hitting Leaders Model (Option 2)
Get Hitting Leaders Async (Option 1)
Get Hitting Leaders Async (Option 2)
View Hitting Leaders Async (Option 1)
View Hitting Leaders Async (Option 2)

member.name: M:BaseballScraper.Controllers.MlbDataApiControllers.MlbDataHittingLeadersController.CreateHittingLeadersModel(System.Int32,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: OPTION 1: Get the current seasons hitting leaders; Endpoint parameters passed as parameters to method
member.remarks: Parameters for 'HittingLeadersEndPoint' (i.e. numberToReturn, year, sortColumn) are passed as parameters to the method
member.param: The number of hitters to return in the results (e.g. 50 would show you the top 50 leaders)
The year that you want to retrieve the leaders for (e.g. 2018 gets you leaders for 2018 mlb season)
This is the stat you want to retrieve the leaders for (e.g., Hr, Rbi etc)
member.see: View 'LeadingHitter' model for options that you can sort by for this method
member.returns: A list of instantiated 'LeadingHitter' for 'numberToReturn' number of hitters

member.name: M:BaseballScraper.Controllers.MlbDataApiControllers.MlbDataHittingLeadersController.CreateHittingLeadersModel
member.summary: OPTION 2: Get the current seasons hitting leaders; Endpoint parameters defined within the method
member.remarks: Parameters for 'HittingLeadersEndPoint' are defined within the method
member.returns: A list of instantiated 'LeadingHitter' for 'numberToReturn' number of hitters

member.summary: Scrapes twitter to find most recent tweets that include 'searchString' that is defined within the method
member.remarks: In Option 1, there are no parameters passed into the method. To change what you are searching for, modify the variable 'searchString' within the method itself
member.returns: A list of tweets

member.summary: Scrapes twitter to find most recent tweets that include 'searchString' parameter
member.remarks: In Option 2, there is one parameter passed into the method. To change what you are searching for, modify the parameter when calling the method
member.param: The string that you would like to search twitter for
member.returns: A list of tweets

member.name: M:BaseballScraper.Controllers.YahooControllers.YahooApiRequestController.GetYahooMlbGameKeyForThisYear
member.summary: The yahoo game id for mlb changes each season This method gets the id for the current year Method is ultimately called in 'GetTheGameIsTheGameLeagueKey' method
member.returns: A string that is three numbers e.g., 378 OR 388

member.name: M:BaseballScraper.Controllers.YahooControllers.YahooApiRequestController.GetTheGameIsTheGameLeagueKeySuffix
member.summary: Each yahoo league has a unique id This method gets the id for the league you want data from The league key suffix is in a config file Method is ultimately called in 'GetTheGameIsTheGameLeagueKey' method
member.returns: A string of lowercase L + the league id e.g., l.1234 OR l.679

member.name: M:BaseballScraper.Controllers.YahooControllers.YahooApiRequestController.GetTheGameIsTheGameLeagueKey
member.summary: To get league day you need the league key The league key is a combo of the mlb game key and the league suffix Methods calls the two previous methods (STEP 1 and STEP 2)
member.returns: A string that is the Y! mlb game key and the league suffix e.g., 378.l.1234 OR 388.l.679

member.name: M:BaseballScraper.Controllers.YahooControllers.YahooApiRequestController.GenerateWebRequest(System.String)
member.summary: Generates the web request using a yahoo api endpoint. Followed by 'GetResponseFromServer()' Method It is ultimatelly called within 'GenerateYahooResourceJObject()' Method
member.param: Endpoint of the yahoo data / json that you want

member.name: M:BaseballScraper.Controllers.YahooControllers.YahooApiRequestController.GetResponseFromServer(System.Net.HttpWebRequest)
member.summary: It receives the response from the request and returns a string of xml Follows 'GenerateWebRequest()' method. Followed by the 'TranslateServerResponseToXml()' Method. It is ultimatelly called within 'GenerateYahooResourceJObject()' Method
member.param: The HttpWebRequest generated in 'GenerateWebRequest()' Method
member.returns: A serverResponse string that looks like Xml (i.e., it's not actually xml)

member.name: M:BaseballScraper.Controllers.YahooControllers.YahooApiRequestController.TranslateServerResponseToXml(System.String)
member.summary: Generate xml from serverResponse string. Follows the 'GetResponseFromServer()' Method It is ultimatelly called within 'GenerateYahooResourceJObject()' Method
member.param: String generated in the 'GetResponseFromServer()' Method
member.returns: Xml document with the Yahoo fantasy data

member.name: M:BaseballScraper.Controllers.YahooControllers.YahooApiRequestController.GenerateYahooResourceJObject(System.String)
member.summary: Generate json for any given yahoo resource (e.g., game, league, player, team, etc.)
member.param: Endpoint of the yahoo data / json that you want
member.returns: Json data (i.e., a JObject) of the fantasy data requested

member.name: M:BaseballScraper.Controllers.YahooControllers.YahooApiRequestController.SaveObjectToDatabase(System.Object)
member.summary: Take in an instance of a yahoo model and save it to the database

member.name: M:BaseballScraper.Controllers.YahooControllers.YahooAuthController.CheckIfUserHasExistingRefreshToken
member.summary: Check if user has existing refresh token If they do have an RT, they have already authorized the app; If they do not they must authorize it PATH 1: Authorize for first time PATH 2: User is already authorized

member.name: M:BaseballScraper.Controllers.YahooControllers.YahooAuthController.GenerateUserAuthorizationCode
member.summary: Triggers browser to open window asking user to authorize usage of their data in the app. When the user approves, they will receive a short authorization code. This code should then be entered in the terminal This is applicable to a first time user (i.e., a user w/o a refresh token)
member.returns: AuthorizationCode which is a string entered in the console

member.name: M:BaseballScraper.Controllers.YahooControllers.YahooAuthController.CreateYahooAccessTokenResponseJObject
member.summary: Generate the 'request' for authorization / Then convert it to a JObject This is for brand new users as it calls the 'GenerateUserAuthorizationCode()' method This is applicable to a first time user (i.e., a user w/o a refresh token)
member.returns: The HttpWebRequest for authorization converted to a JObject

member.name: M:BaseballScraper.Controllers.YahooControllers.YahooAuthController.CreateYahooAccessTokenRequest
member.summary: Generate the HttpWebRequest for authorization This is for brand new users as it calls the 'GenerateUserAuthorizationCode()' method This is applicable to a first time user (i.e., a user w/o a refresh token)

member.name: M:BaseballScraper.Controllers.YahooControllers.YahooAuthController.ExchangeRefreshTokenForNewAccessTokenJObject
member.summary: If user has a refresh token, this is the path Yahoo API auth process step 5: 'Exchange refresh token for new access token' Yahoo description: After the access token expires, you can use the refresh token, which has a long lifetime, to get a new access token. For notes / comments on this method check it's 'sister' method (CreateYahooAccessTokenResponseJObject) in

member.name: M:BaseballScraper.Controllers.YahooControllers.YahooAuthController.ExchangeRefreshTokenForNewAccessToken
member.summary: This is a condensed version of 'ExchangeRefreshTokenForNewAccessTokenJObject()' and returns a HttpWebRequest instead of a JObject If user has a refresh token, this is the path Yahoo API auth process step 5: 'Exchange refresh token for new access token' Yahoo description: After the access token expires, you can use the refresh token, which has a long lifetime, to get a new access token. For notes / comments on this method check it's 'sister' method (CreateYahooAccessTokenResponseJObject) in

member.name: M:BaseballScraper.Controllers.YahooControllers.YahooAuthController.ExchangeRefreshTokenStringbuilder(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)

member.name: M:BaseballScraper.Controllers.YahooControllers.YahooTeamStatsController.CreateYahooTeamStatsModel

member.remarks: Includes: H/AB, R, HR, RBI, SB, BB, IP, W, SV, H, ERA, WHIP

member.name: M:BaseballScraper.Controllers.YahooControllers.YahooTeamStatsController.CreateYahooTeamStatsModel(System.Int32)
member.summary: Create new instance of YahooTeamStats Mode; Show full season stats for one team
member.remarks: Within Option 2, there is one parameter passed into the method - the 'teamId'; This option must be called by another method. To change the team you want to view the stats for, change the id number you are passing when calling the method
member.param: A number between 0 and the total number of teams in the league with each number in between representing one of the teams (i.e., each team has its own unique team id number)
member.returns: new YahooTeamStatsModel
member.remarks: Includes: H/AB, R, HR, RBI, SB, BB, IP, W, SV, H, ERA, WHIP

member.name: M:BaseballScraper.Controllers.YahooControllers.YahooTeamStatsController.ViewTeamStats

member.summary: Create new instance of YahooTeamStats Mode; Show full season stats for one team
member.remarks: Within Option 3, there are two parameters. To change the team you are searching for, change the team id within the url itself
member.param: A number between 0 and the total number of teams in the league with each number in between representing one of the teams (i.e., each team has its own unique team id number)

member.remarks: Includes: H/AB, R, HR, RBI, SB, BB, IP, W, SV, H, ERA, WHIP

member.name: T:BaseballScraper.Infrastructure.RdotNetConnector
member.summary: Includes various R functions / actions
member.list:
RESOURCES
https://billpetti.github.io/baseballr/data-acquisition-functions/
https://pitchrx.cpsievert.me
Book: Analyzing Baseball Data With R
http://lahman.r-forge.r-project.org/doc/

PROCESS TO START: three steps needed to get csharp and R to work together; enter these in terminal in succession before attempting to run any of the below
(1) export LD_LIBRARY_PATH=/Library/Frameworks/R.framework/Libraries/:$LD_LIBRARY_PATH
(2) export PATH=/Library/Frameworks/R.framework/Libraries/:$PATH
(3) export R_HOME=/Library/Frameworks/R.framework/Resources

REQUIRED R PACKAGES
install.packages("pitchRx")
install.packages("baseballr")
install.packages("Lahman")

member.name: M:BaseballScraper.Infrastructure.RdotNetConnector.CreateNewREngine
member.summary: Creates a new engine that drives other R functions
member.returns: A new R Engine

member.name: M:BaseballScraper.Infrastructure.RdotNetConnector.ImportBaseballR
member.summary: Imports the baseballr library

member.name: M:BaseballScraper.Infrastructure.RdotNetConnector.GetLahmanPlayerInfo(System.String)
member.summary: Get Mlb player's Player Id, First Name, Last Name

member.name: M:BaseballScraper.Infrastructure.RdotNetConnector.GetPitchRxData(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Scrapes and returns a significant amount of data about each individual at bat within a given date range
member.param: First date of the range you are looking for (e.g, "2016-04-06")
Last date of the range you are looking for (e.g, "2016-06-21")

list.item: AT BAT: pitcher (id), batter (id), num (pitch number?), b, s, o, start_tfs, start_tfs_zulu, stand, b_height, p_throws, atbat_des, home_team_runs, away_team_runs, url (for XML), inning_side(top OR bottom), inning, next_, event2, batter_name, pitcher_name, gameday_link, date

ACTION: b, s, o, des, event, tfs_zulu, player (id), pitch (number), event_num, home_team_runs, away_team_runs, url (for XML), inning_side (top OR bottom), inning, next_, num, score, event2, gameday_link
PITCH: des, id, type (B, S, X), tfs, tfs_zulu, x, y, event_num, sv_id, play_guid, start_speed, end_speed, sz_top, sz_top, pfx_x, pfx_z, px, pz, x0, y0, z0, vx0, vy0, vz0, ax, ay, az, break_y

members.member: Get statcast data for individual games between a start and end date _r.ScrapeBaseballSavantStatcast("2016-04-06", "2016-04-15", 592789); First date of the range you are looking for (e.g, "2016-04-06") Last date of the range you are looking for (e.g, "2016-06-21") The player's MLBAMID you are looking for to get a player's playerId pitch_type, game_date, release_speed, release_pos_x, release_pos_z, player_name, and many more https://billpetti.github.io/baseballr/data-acquisition-functions/

member.name: M:BaseballScraper.Infrastructure.RdotNetConnector.GetFanGraphsHitterLeaderboard(System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: OPTION 1A --> Retrieve FanGraphs hitter leader board for: SINGLE SEASON | ALL MLB | QUALIFIED or UNQUALIFIED
member.param: The year of the season you want to get the leaders for
Whether to include only batters that were qualified. Defaults to 'y'. Alternatively, you can pass a minimum number of plate appearances to restrict the data to.

member.name: M:BaseballScraper.Infrastructure.RdotNetConnector.GetFanGraphsHitterLeaderboard(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: OPTION 1B --> Retrieve FanGraphs hitter leader board for: SINGLE SEASON | ALL MLB | players with PLATE APPEARANCES greater than defined #
member.param: The year of the season you want to get the leaders for
Number of plate appearances a hitter needs to show up in the results.

member.name: M:BaseballScraper.Infrastructure.RdotNetConnector.GetFanGraphsHitterLeaderboard(System.Int32,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: OPTION 2 --> Retrieve FanGraphs hitter leader board for: SINGLE SEASON | ALL or AL or NL | QUALIFIED or UNQUALIFIED
member.param: The year of the season you want to get the leaders for
You can get records for all of MLB ('all'), the National League ('nl'), or the American League ('al')
Whether to include only batters that were qualified. Defaults to 'y'. Alternatively, you can pass a minimum number of plate appearances to restrict the data to.

member.name: M:BaseballScraper.Infrastructure.RdotNetConnector.GetFanGraphsGuts
member.summary: Retrieves components and constants FanGraphs uses for calculating metrics such as wOBA and FIP

member.name: M:BaseballScraper.Infrastructure.RdotNetConnector.GetMlbStandingsOnDate(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Get mlb standings on a specific date for a particular league (AL or NL) and division
member.remarks: Differs from 'GetMlbStandingsFromDateForward' in that the 'from' parameter is FALSE
member.param: A combination of league and division (e.g, "AL Central")
member.example: If you want league/division do something like "AL Central"
If you want overall league standings do "AL Overall"
member.param: The date that you want to view standings for (e.g, "2015-08-01")
member.returns: tm, W, L, W-L%, GB, RS, RA, pythW-L%

member.name: M:BaseballScraper.Infrastructure.RdotNetConnector.GetMlbStandingsFromDateForward(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Get mlb standings from a specific date moving forward for a particular league (AL or NL) and division
member.remarks: Differs from 'GetMlbStandingsOnDate' in that the 'from' parameter is TRUE
member.param: A combination of league and division (e.g, "AL Central")
member.example: If you want league/division do something like "AL Central"
If you want overall league standings do "AL Overall"
member.param: The date that you want to view standings forward from (e.g, "2015-08-01")
member.returns: tm, W, L, W-L%, GB, RS, RA, pythW-L%

member.name: M:BaseballScraper.Infrastructure.RdotNetConnector.GetPlayerEdgePercentage(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: The edge_scrape() function allows the user to scrape PITCHf/x data from the GameDay application using Carson Sieverts pitchRx package and to calculate metrics associated with Edge%.
member.param: First date of the range you are looking for (e.g, "2016-04-06")
Last date of the range you are looking for (e.g, "2016-06-21")
Position type. Two options: 'pitcher' OR 'batter'

member.name: M:BaseballScraper.Infrastructure.RdotNetConnector.CalculatePitcherWinningPercentage
member.summary: Get a single pitcher's winning percentage
